SUMMARY: Nac, Nitrogen assimilation control, regulates, without a coeffector, genes involved in nitrogen metabolism under nitrogen-limiting conditions [9495755]. genes regulated by Nac are transcribed by RNA polymerase σ70. se genes are coupled to nitrogen regulatory (Ntr) system, which is σ54 dependent, through Nac, whose transcription is activated by NtrC [9495755]. Using DNA microarray analyses, it was shown that Nac could affect expression of 25 genes [11121068]. This transcriptional regulator is negatively autoregulated [9495755] and is expressed under nitrogen-limiting conditions [9785451]. Nac belongs to LysR family [9495755] and features a helix-turn-helix motif located close to N terminus [9922258]. In contrast with most LysR family members, which are transcribed divergently from gene y regulate, nac is distant on genome from its regulated genes [9495755]. In Klebsiella pneumoniae, Nac functions as a dimer, and for some sites it can bind as a tetramer; it recognizes long and short sites in absence of a coeffector [20363946].
